name.en: Authors of the Generations of World Wars, East and West: Texts, Manuscripts and Their Circles
name.ch: 大戰世代中外作者：文本，手稿及其圈子

goal.en: Using World War I and II as a historical and theoretical perspective, the course aims to look at authors, East and West, who are born of the general period and those who live in its aftermath. The course intends to examine how the generations of writers reflect on and try to move beyond the crises through their experimental texts, their experimental creative modes as revealed in their manuscripts and through their utopian and visionary circles of like-minded or not so like-minded friends. By juxtaposing printed texts, related manuscript archives and authors’ circles, the course will attempt to familiarize the student with the related theories and current debates.
goal.ch: 以兩次世界大戰做為起點，探討在時代巨變之中，作家如何透過創作，創作形式以及經由手稿材料更能透露出來的創作、思考乃至歷史反省批判與改造的模式，回應時代的危機。以二次世界大戰以及在戰爭氛圍與遺續與影響的世代作為討論和探索範圍，從刊印文本出發，再至手稿檔案，最後擴作者所參與之結社與其他廣義之圈子，以期學生能夠理解文本，手稿與創作及文化之生態圈之間同心或不同心關連之背後意涵以及相關理論與當代論辯。

content.en: The writers belonging the generation that we will deal with in class include Chou Mengdi, Wang Wenhsing, Guo Songfen, and Yang Mu. In addition, Western authors from roughly similar historical period will also be included. In the latter category, we will read Virginia Woolf, Water Benjamin and Aby Warburg.
content.ch: 本課程將閱讀兩次世界大戰世代的中外作家。中文作家將包括周夢蝶，王文興，郭松棻以及楊牧等人。以英文寫作之大戰時代作家，將包括吳爾夫，班雅民以及瓦堡。
